function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Soap and water alone may not be effective at deactivating the virus on surfaces","Impact":"Increased risk of virus transmission via contaminated surfaces","Mitigation":"Use cleaning substances with proven effectiveness against the virus","Technologies":"Effective cleaning substances, such as those containing sodium hypochlorite","People":"Individuals who come into contact with contaminated surfaces","Owner":"Cleaning product manufacturers, government health agencies"},{"Description":"Sodium laureth sulfate in soaps may cause irritation and is not suitable for sensitive skin","Impact":"Risk of skin irritation and adverse reactions","Mitigation":"Avoid using products containing sodium laureth sulfate for sensitive skin","Technologies":"Development of soaps without sodium laureth sulfate","People":"Individuals with sensitive skin and other skin conditions","Owner":"Cosmetic companies, regulatory bodies"},{"Description":"Unclear guidance on social distancing indoors based on droplet transmission","Impact":"Risk of inadequate social distancing measures leading to disease transmission","Mitigation":"Providing clear and evidence-based guidance on appropriate social distancing measures","Technologies":"Models for disease transmission, research on droplet behavior","People":"General public, individuals in indoor environments","Owner":"Public health organizations, research institutions"}]}
